bibl.title: Life after Death: An Original Form of Bilingual Iconography in the Necropolis of Kawm al-Shuqafa.

series.title: Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications.

bibl.note: The paintings of the tombs (by examination using ultra-violet light) provide new evidence of the multicultural character of Alexandrian life.
bibl.seg: GUIMIER-SORBETS Anne-Marie and Mervat SEIF EL-DIN, Life after Death: An Original Form of Bilingual Iconography in the Necropolis of Kawm al-Shuqafa.
Anthony HIRST and Michael SILK (Edd.), Alexandria, Real and Imagined = Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications. 5 (Aldershot, 2004) pp. 133-141, 8 figg.
The paintings of the tombs (by examination using ultra-violet light) provide new evidence of the multicultural character of Alexandrian life.
